content: I’m a recently-graduated ecologist with a PhD from Ghent University, Belgium. I took a somewhat windy early career path, starting out as a wildlife manager and ecological consultant, after which I specialized in geoinformatics and biostatistics. My PhD work focused on disease ecology of the recently emerged fungal pathogen Batrachochytrium salamandrivorans in north-western Europe. I mostly study amphibians, preferably salamanders, and have a broad interest in herpetology. This website works as a small portfolio and contact page to easily connect you to my academic work, repositories, photography, and other projects.
summary: I’m a recently-graduated ecologist with a PhD from Ghent University, Belgium. I took a somewhat windy early career path, starting out as a wildlife manager and ecological consultant, after which I specialized in geoinformatics and biostatistics.
title: Wouter Beukema
